title: The ATO ecosystem
text: Acoustic Telemetry Object (ATO) ecosystem proposed standard intended take acoustic telemetry data analysis reproducibility new level. first envisioned actel, intended serve exactly purpose just described , find somewhat amusing. Back actel first came , users quickly recognized detailed level reporting rigidity predetermined analysis path indeed big steps forward making data analysis field reproducible easier remember. However, rigidity ultimately one biggest flaws. use actel, must follow predetermined paths. room growth. one thing kill package/standard faster anything else, unable grow. years since actel came , attempts made slightly alleviate rigidity e.g. introducing preload() function, allowed users manipulate objects R introducing one actel’s “big three” analysis functions (explore, migration, residency). band-aid solution deep surgery really necessary. , universe telemetry packages kept expanding, became clear (almost) every package isolated world, drifting alone. Moving actel glatos yaps others requires whole tutorials convert data formats one . , isolated, don’t evolve, evolve, fall behind. Long discussions (even joined topic) deal . Package maintainers talk . Packages designed separate tasks. Care given guide community users towards trusted, updated packages analyses sound. Graduate students shouldn’t keep reinventing wheel falling pitfalls worked code. always elephant room: packages don’t talk language (.e. don’t accept inputs). essential allow users move package package, also essential importing data ever-growing ever-refined data storage manage systems (OTN, ETN, BTN, FACT, IMOS, among others keep learning ). concept package surimi – time part discussion – first big step towards saying “packages need talk .” surimi envisioned centre spoke wheel, facilitating conversion data package package B, providing input methods gathering data data management systems. Bruce Delo, Jon Pye, sat discussed surimi different occasions, something became apparent: conversion potentially cause data loss, something happy . point, memory serves right, thought appeared: “need common data format everyone…” daunting idea, immediately widely known xkcd comic comes mind, one thinks lost cause. alas, despite warnings world-beloved stick figure, exactly going try .

title: The ATO ecosystem
text: ATO intended S4 object class meant hold data pertaining specific acoustic telemetry study. class essentially wrapper smaller objects specific S4 classes, three essential ATO object usable: detections, receiver deployments, tag information1. Assembling three data sources ATO object makes “usable.” first innovation comes : ATO object check quality. , bring three data sources together, resulting ATO object immediately let know , e.g., detections receivers listed deployments, receivers detections, detections tags listed, etc. combinations rather extensive, deciding appropriate check step one great challenges new ecosystem. ever used actel, just described likely sound familiar. actel rigidity, flexibility. Dedicated functions allow adding detections, deployments, tags, etc.: checked --fly already existing data contained ATO. Optional elements shapefile study area may also provided, enabling functionalities packages adopt ATO standard. example, actel can calculate distances receivers given positions shapefile, RSP uses shape files refine movement paths trim space-usage models.

title: The ATO ecosystem
text: One biggest steps telemetry analysis determining quality detections ’ve collected. binary decision keeping discarding detection power change outcome study, something researchers often struggle . also one steps reproducibility often lost. detections excluded? excluded? impact results? answers questions often hard track. solution actel lock entire process behind rigid pipeline records everything done analysis. , time, rigidity proven problematic limits innovation isolates actel rest telemetry package universe. ATO ecosystem, filter_ check_ functions give users flexibility perform different quality-control actions according preferences. might feel like going back actel attempted prevent first place, ’s catch: filter_ check_ functions equipped record actions (consequences) central log contained within ATO. log central piece ATO, allows users review changes made throughout analysis particular telemetry dataset. , logs allow ATO automatically propagate changes applied part remaining sub-objects contained within (.e. invalidate detections, respective movement events – ’ll get – get updated well). Importantly, quality-checking never delete detections (working unit ATO). Rather, soon data-quality function used, new object containing filtered detections created within ATO. Finally, data-quality functions longer live locked within predetermined analysis within specific package. Users wanting expand types quality control performed may simply join ecosystem develop filter_ check_ functions. Quality-control functions require elements currently exist ATO must instead guide user missing incorporate .

title: The ATO ecosystem
text: unified object format really starts shine. three essential inputs (detections, deployments, tags) one may, example, create movements (combining three). One may make dedicated spatial data frame condensing deployments. One may provide additional inputs (shapefile) make distances matrix receivers. things can make work first level, e.g. survival tables, residency times, etc. elements sound familiar actel’s outputs familiar , anything can added ATO bringing together different components ATO use make_ family functions. turn, expanded ATO opens possibility refined quality checking, thus allowing user move back forth elements analysis progress towards final result. Importantly, expanding ATO alter core structure. essential whole ecosystem work, allows user carry ATO package package B without fear might longer work given analysis. Version control essential part ATO framework. users may expand ATO refilter , ATO must able determine parts affected changes, either recompute mark obsolete. strongly supported internal log, object may use determine something changed .

what: Viewing and extracting data from an ATO
title: The ATO ecosystem
text: Throughout process making different elements ATO, user may want view summaries different elements, display full contents, /calculate specific metrics. view_ get_ functions assist . Using example actel; important view_ function view_report() (PS, maybe get_report() instead?). Similarly, one calculate recalculate different flavours distances speeds using get_distances() get_speeds() functions different argument combinations. applies times arrival, times residence, numbers detections, etc; functions usable complex ATOs. , opens door new developers creating functions calculating metrics contributing ecosystem (e.g., someone develop get_overlaps() function).

what: So… are the actel analyses going away?
title: The ATO ecosystem
text: great thing ATO ecosystem , complex analysis pipelines need go away! fact, open whole new avenue developers tailor analysis pipelines, encapsulate within “actel-analysis-like” functions others can use. ATO ecosystem allow us break free rigidity limits actel’s expansion lead future new pipelines can created improved several people. Note 2025 Note: names generally outdated. kept record things started.

title: S4 class: ATO — ATO-class
text: Acoustic Telemetry Object (ATO) class contains slots allow researchers package study data standard format, used R packages collectively make trackyverse.

title: S4 class: ATO — ATO-class
text: det detections slot. See ATO_det. dep deployments slot. See ATO_dep. tag tags slot. See ATO_tag. ani animals slot. See ATO_ani. obs observations slot. See ATO_obs. log log slot. See ATO_log. tbl table style slot. See ATO_tbl. pkg list slot reserved package outputs.

title: S4 class: ATO_ani — ATO_ani
text: S4 class ATO animals (@ani). contain internal slots. table either data.frame, data.table, tibble format.

title: S4 class: ATO_ani — ATO_ani
S4 class: ATO_ani — ATO_ani
text: data frame 0 rows 9 variables: animal Name animal received tag, character. capture_location Name location animal captured, character. capture_datetime date time capture, posixct. capture_lat latitude capture. Preferably WGS84, numeric. capture_lon longitude capture. Preferably WGS84, numeric. release_location Name location animal released, character. release_datetime date time release, posixct. release_lat latitude release. Preferably WGS84, numeric. release_lon longitude release. Preferably WGS84, numeric. object class ATO_ani (inherits data.frame) 0 rows 9 columns.

title: S4 class: ATO_ani — ATO_ani
text: prototype @ani slot contains standard columns @ani slot. columns allowed, necessary, must designated types. ani slot contains information animals tagged. Can type data.frame, data.table, tibble, depending @tbl slot. See table_type details ATO table types.

title: S4 class: ATO_dep — ATO_dep
text: S4 class ATO deployments (@dep). contain internal slots. table either data.frame, data.table, tibble format.

title: S4 class: ATO_dep — ATO_dep
S4 class: ATO_dep — ATO_dep
text: data frame 0 rows 16 variables: receiver_model Model receiver, character. receiver_serial Receiver serial number, integer. receiver_codeset Codeset receiver, character. deploy_location Name location receiver deployed, character. deploy_datetime date time deployment, posixct. deploy_lat latitude deployment. Preferably WGS84, numeric. deploy_lon longitude deployment. Preferably WGS84, numeric. deploy_z depth deployment, measured reference surface water body, numeric. recover_datetime date time recovery, posixct. recover_lat latitude recovery point. Preferably WGS84, numeric. recover_lon longitude recovery point. Preferably WGS84, numeric. transmitter Transmitter code beacon/reference tag, character. transmitter_manufacturer Manufacturer transmitter, character. transmitter_ping_rate Expected ping rate transmitter, numeric. seconds. transmitter_model Model transmitter, character. transmitter_serial Serial number transmitter, integer. object class ATO_dep (inherits data.frame) 0 rows 16 columns.

title: S4 class: ATO_dep — ATO_dep
text: prototype @dep slot contains standard columns @dep slot. columns allowed, necessary, must designated types. Deployments include deployments receivers (receiver information filled transmitter information ); transceivers (receiver transmitter information filled ; .e. receiver beacon tag); reference tags (receiver information, transmitter information). Can type data.frame, data.table, tibble, depending @tbl slot. See table_type details ATO table types.

title: S4 class: ATO_det — ATO_det
text: S4 class ATO detections (@det). contain internal slots. table either data.frame, data.table, tibble format.

title: S4 class: ATO_det — ATO_det
S4 class: ATO_det — ATO_det
text: data frame 0 rows 5 variables: datetime date time, posixct format. frac_second fractional second, numeric. receiver_serial receiver serial number, integer. transmitter transmitter code, character. sensor_value reported sensor value, numeric. object class ATO_det (inherits data.frame) 0 rows 6 columns.

title: S4 class: ATO_det — ATO_det
text: prototype @det slot contains standard columns @det slot. columns allowed, necessary, must designated types. Can type data.frame, data.table, tibble, depending @tbl slot. See table_type details ATO table types.

title: S4 class: ATO_log — ATO_log
S4 class: ATO_log — ATO_log
text: data frame 0 rows 4 variables: datetime date time log entry, posixct format. package name package hosts function made log entry, character. call function call made log entry, character. log log entry, character. object class ATO_log (inherits data.frame) 0 rows 4 columns.

title: S4 class: ATO_log — ATO_log
text: prototype @log slot contains standard columns @log slot. columns allowed. Contains summary information actions performed throughout life ATO. Can type data.frame, data.table, tibble, depending @tbl slot. See table_type details ATO table types.

title: S4 class: ATO_obs — ATO_obs
text: S4 class ATO observations (@obs). contain internal slots. table either data.frame, data.table, tibble format.

title: S4 class: ATO_obs — ATO_obs
S4 class: ATO_obs — ATO_obs
text: data frame 0 rows 8 variables: animal Name animal observed, character. transmitter Transmitter code observed, character. type Type observation (e.g. directly seen, manual tracking), character. terminal animal permanently captured moment observation? logical. location Name place observation occurred, character. datetime date time observation, posixct format. lat latitude observation. Preferably WGS84, numeric. lon longitude observation. Preferably WGS84, numeric. object class ATO_obs (inherits data.frame) 0 rows 9 columns.

title: S4 class: ATO_obs — ATO_obs
text: prototype @obs slot contains standard columns @obs slot. columns allowed, necessary, must designated types. observations slot contains information locations animal seen tag heard. E.g. fin observations, detections manual tracking. Can type data.frame, data.table, tibble, depending @tbl slot. See table_type details ATO table types.

text: data frame 0 rows 12 variables: manufacturer Manufacturer transmitter, character. model Model transmitter, character. power_level Power level transmitter, real. ping_rate Expected ping rate transmitter, numeric. seconds. ping_variation Range variation added pings, reduce tag collisions, numeric. seconds serial Serial number tag, integer. transmitter Transmitter code, character. activation_datetime date time tag activation, posixct. battery_life expected battery duration tag, numeric. sensor_type Type sensor data associated transmitter, character. sensor_unit Unit data associated transmitter, character. animal Name animal received tag, character. object class ATO_tag (inherits data.frame) 0 rows 12 columns.

title: S4 class: ATO_tag — ATO_tag
text: prototype @tag slot contains standard columns @tag slot. columns allowed, necessary, must designated types. tag slot contains information different transmitters tracked. Tags multiple transmitter codes coded multiple rows associated single serial number single animal. Can type data.frame, data.table, tibble, depending @tbl slot. See table_type details ATO table types.

text: Formats input data ATO format appends ATO_obs class.

title: Make an ATO observations object — make_obs
code: make_obs(   animal = NA_character_,   transmitter = NA_character_,   type = NA_character_,   terminal = NA,   location = NA_character_,   datetime = as.POSIXct(NA_real_),   lat = NA_real_,   lon = NA_real_,   tz,   ... )

title: Make an ATO observations object — make_obs
text: animal Name animal observed, character. transmitter Transmitter code observed, character. type Type observation (e.g. directly seen, manual tracking), character. terminal animal permanently captured moment observation? logical. location Name place observation occurred, character. datetime date time observation, posixct format. lat latitude observation. Preferably WGS84, numeric. lon longitude observation. Preferably WGS84, numeric. tz timezone datetime data. ... Non-standard columns added table.

title: Make an ATO observations object — make_obs
text: ATO_obs object, ready used add init_ato.

what: Make an ATO tags object — make_tag
title: Make an ATO tags object — make_tag
text: Formats input data ATO format appends ATO_tag class.

title: Make an ATO tags object — make_tag
code: make_tag(   manufacturer = NA_character_,   model = NA_character_,   power_level = NA_real_,   ping_rate = NA_real_,   ping_variation = NA_real_,   serial = NA_integer_,   transmitter = NA_character_,   activation_datetime = as.POSIXct(NA_real_),   battery_life = NA_real_,   sensor_type = NA_character_,   sensor_unit = NA_character_,   animal = NA_character_,   tz,   ... )

title: Make an ATO tags object — make_tag
text: manufacturer Manufacturer transmitter, character. model Model transmitter, character. power_level Power level transmitter, real. ping_rate Expected ping rate transmitter, numeric. seconds. ping_variation Range variation added pings, reduce tag collisions, numeric. seconds serial Serial number tag, integer. transmitter Transmitter code, character. activation_datetime date time tag activation, posixct. battery_life expected battery duration tag, numeric. sensor_type Type sensor data associated transmitter, character. sensor_unit Unit data associated transmitter, character. animal Name animal received tag, character. tz timezone datetime data. ... Non-standard columns added table.

title: Make an ATO tags object — make_tag
text: ATO_tag object, ready used add init_ato.
